name: DRD: Design Requirements Document (Template)
description:
DRD is a 5-step framework that works with inputs from PMs and their PRD to minimize efforts on documentation. DRD helps the designers and their product teams diverge on ideations and converge on solutions. DRD, in essence, is a subset of the PRD, covering all the bases of design.

You can integrate into your workflow as:

  • as a subset of a PRD, or
  • using it on its own to provide a framework for the ideation process.

I have kept a particular focus on PRD because it helps the product team better address problems but you can take out and use each of the individual steps according to your need.
